name: Box Bench
description: Benchmark tests for Box MCP operations

tests.name: Level 0: Get Me
tests.prompt: Call `box_users_get_me` to get the current user ID, then create a folder named 'User_<ID>' (replace <ID> with the actual ID) in the root.

tests.name: Level 0: Create Folder Call
tests.prompt: Call `box_folders_create` to create a folder named 'Test_Folder_0' with parent_id '0'.

tests.name: Level 0: Search Call
tests.prompt: Call `box_search` with query 'census' and type 'file'. Rename the first file found in the results to 'found_census_item'.

tests.name: Level 4: Rename Folder from CSV (CPI)
tests.prompt: In the investments area, locate the folder that contains macroeconomic CSV datasets (it includes a huge CPI/price indexes CSV and a transport registrations CSV). Find the CPI/price indexes CSV for December 2025, download/read it, and extract the first data row values for Series_reference and Series_title_1. Rename the macro-data folder to `macro_<Series_reference>` + `_` + `<Series_title_1>`, but replace '.' with '_' in the Series_reference. Then add a comment on that folder: `series=<Series_reference>; title=<Series_title_1>`.

tests.name: Level 0: List Folder Items
tests.prompt: Call `box_folders_list_items` for folder ID '5610825569' (investments). If there are more than 0 items, create a folder 'List_Success' inside it.

tests.name: Level 1: Get Current User
tests.prompt: Find out who I am logged in as, and create a folder named exactly equal to my user name in the root directory.

tests.name: Level 1: Search for FOMC
tests.prompt: Search for files with 'fomc' in the name. Add a comment 'Relevant' to the first file found.

tests.name: Level 1: Get File Info
tests.prompt: Get information about the file 'goog-10-q-q2-2025.pdf' (ID 2748861636). Add a comment to it saying 'Size checked'.

tests.name: Level 1: Create Folder
tests.prompt: Create a new folder named 'Analysis_2026' inside the 'investments' folder (ID 5610825569).

tests.name: Level 1: Rename Folder
tests.prompt: Rename the 'macroeconomics' folder (ID 1973339758) to 'Global Economics'.

tests.name: Level 1: Move File
tests.prompt: Move the file 'transport-april-2025-csv.csv' (ID 1421498350) into the 'investments' folder (ID 5610825569).

tests.name: Level 1: Add Comment
tests.prompt: Add a comment 'Needs review' to the folder 'investments' (ID 5610825569).

tests.name: Level 1: Create Task
tests.prompt: Create a task 'Verify data' for file 'transport-april-2025-csv.csv' (ID 1421498350).

tests.name: Level 1: Create Hub
tests.prompt: Create a new Box Hub titled 'Research Center'.

tests.name: Level 1: Check File Access
tests.prompt: Verify '2001 crisis notes.txt' (ID 5696874158) is accessible by renaming it to '2001_accessible.txt'.

tests.name: Level 1: Lock File
tests.prompt: Lock the file '2001 crisis notes.txt' (ID 5696874158) to prevent editing.

tests.name: Level 1: Create Folder (No Delete Available)
tests.prompt: Create a folder named 'Temp_Delete' in the root. Since delete may not be available, rename it to 'Temp_Deleted' to mark it as cleaned up.

tests.name: Level 1: Get Folder Info
tests.prompt: Get details for the 'investments' folder (ID 5610825569) and change its description to 'Audit Complete'.

tests.name: Level 2: Create and Move
tests.prompt: Create a new folder named 'Finance_Reports' inside 'investments' (ID 5610825569), and then move the file 'goog-10-q-q2-2025.pdf' (ID 2748861636) into it.

tests.name: Level 2: Comment and Task
tests.prompt: In the history area, find the plain-text study notes about Argentina's 2001 economic crisis. Add a comment 'Please review this note' to that file and then create a task 'Review content' for the same file.

tests.name: Level 2: Rename and Move
tests.prompt: Rename the file 'transport-april-2025-csv.csv' (ID 1421498350) to 'transport_v2.csv' and move it to the 'macroeconomics' folder (ID 1973339758).

tests.name: Level 4: Upload TXT named from CSV (Transport)
tests.prompt: In the same macro-data folder, find the transport registrations CSV (it has columns like Series_reference, Period, Data_value). Download/read it and take the first data row values for Series_reference and Period. Upload a new small TXT file into the macro-data folder named `transport_<Series_reference>_<Period>.txt`, but replace '.' with '_' in both fields. The file content should include the extracted Series_reference, Period, and Data_value from that first row.

tests.name: Level 2: Hub Setup
tests.prompt: Create a Hub named 'Economic Data' and add the 'macroeconomics' folder (ID 1973339758) to it.

tests.name: Level 2: Find and Move
tests.prompt: Find the file named 'interviewing tips FINAL.txt'. If found, move it to the 'investments' folder (ID 5610825569).

tests.name: Level 2: Nested Folders
tests.prompt: Create a folder 'Project_Beta' in root, then create a subfolder 'Docs' inside it, and move 'interviewing tips FINAL.txt' (ID 1364279594) into 'Docs'.

tests.name: Level 3: Find and Move All
tests.prompt: Find all files with 'fomc' in their name. Create a new folder named 'FOMC_Reports' in the root directory, and move all found files into it.

tests.name: Level 3: Find and Task
tests.prompt: Find the 'goog-10-q-q2-2025.pdf' file and create a task on it saying 'Extract Revenue'.

tests.name: Level 3: Count and Comment
tests.prompt: Count how many files are in the 'investments' folder (ID 5610825569) and post a comment on the folder with the count.

tests.name: Level 3: List and Rename
tests.prompt: List items in the main history folder. Find the plain-text notes about Argentina's 2001 economic crisis and rename that file to EXACTLY '2001_crisis_notes_checked.txt' (ensure there is only one .txt extension; do NOT rename it to '...txt.txt').

tests.name: Level 3: Search and Rename Folder
tests.prompt: In the macroeconomics area, there is a dataset folder that contains dozens of 2018 Census CSV files (national highlights / totals by topic). Find that dataset folder and rename it to 'Census_2018_Data'.

tests.name: Level 4: Read and Tag Content
tests.prompt: Find the plain-text study notes about Argentina's 2001 economic crisis, download/read the file content, and if it mentions 'Argentina', add the tag 'Latin_America' to that file.

tests.name: Level 4: Read CSV and Comment
tests.prompt: Find the transport dataset CSV from April 2025 (in the investments/macroeconomics area). Download/read it, count the total number of lines (INCLUDING the header), and add a comment to the file exactly in the format: `Line count: 44761`.

tests.name: Level 4: Read and Summarize
tests.prompt: Read 'interviewing tips FINAL.txt' (ID 1364279594). Post a ONE-SENTENCE comment summarizing ONLY the 'BEFORE THE INTERVIEW' section. The comment MUST include these exact phrases: 'informed consent', 'backup batteries', 'open-ended questions'.

tests.name: Level 4: Read and Create Task
tests.prompt: Find the plain-text study notes about Argentina's 2001 economic crisis, download/read it, and create a task 'Update based on notes' for that file.

tests.name: Level 4: Search Read Move
tests.prompt: Search for 'crisis', read the first text file found, and if it contains the year '2001', move it into the main history folder.

tests.name: Level 4: Read CSV and Rename
tests.prompt: Read 'transport-april-2025-csv.csv' (ID 1421498350). If the header contains 'Date', rename the file to 'transport_verified.csv'.

tests.name: Level 4: Read and Task Rapport
tests.prompt: Read 'interviewing tips FINAL.txt' (ID 1364279594). If you find the word 'rapport', create a task 'Practice rapport' on the file.

tests.name: Level 3: Ambiguous Sorting
tests.prompt: Look at the files in the 'investments' folder. Rename the smallest file to 'smallest_file' (keep extension) and the largest file to 'largest_file' (keep extension).

tests.name: Level 3: Ambiguous Folder Selection (No Delete)
tests.prompt: Create a folder named 'Backup' in the root directory, and another folder named 'Backup' inside the 'investments' folder. Then, rename the 'Backup' folder that is inside 'investments' to 'Backup_in_investments' (do not touch the root one).

tests.name: Level 3: Deduplication Strategy
tests.prompt: Create a file named 'goog-10-q-q2-2025.txt' inside the 'investments' folder. Then scan 'investments' for files with the same base name (ignoring extension). If you find duplicates, rename the PDF version to 'goog-10-q-q2-2025.DUPLICATE.pdf'.

tests.name: Level 3: Conditional Logic (Size)
tests.prompt: Check the size of the file named 'transport-april-2025-csv.csv' inside 'investments'. If it's larger than 1MB, rename it to 'large_transport.csv', otherwise rename it to 'small_transport.csv'.

tests.name: Level 3: Remove Duplicate (Buenos Aires)
tests.prompt: In the history area, open the 'Buenos Aires' folder and identify any duplicate markdown files that appear to be copies of the same Dirty War class notes. Use clues like near-identical filenames and identical file size to decide which one is the duplicate copy. Keep the canonical original and delete/trash only the duplicate.

tests.name: Level 3: Typo Fix Search
tests.prompt: In the history readings, find the ethics note whose filename misspells either 'judgment' or 'history'. Fix the spelling in the filename (do not change the content).

tests.name: Level 3: Sort Misfiled Reading
tests.prompt: In the personal_final history area, there is a digital humanities reading that was stored directly under the main 'history' folder instead of under 'readings/digital humanities'. Find the misfiled text reading about digital history methods and move it into the 'digital humanities' folder under 'readings'.

tests.name: Level 3: Extension Cleanup
tests.prompt: Find the Buenos Aires note that is marked as a draft in its filename. Rename it to remove the 'DRAFT' marker and change the extension from .md to .txt (no download/reupload needed; this is just a rename).

tests.name: Level 4: Hard Reasoning Archive
tests.prompt: Read 'intro to hist methods.md'. If it mentions 'methodology', create a folder named 'Methodology_Archive' and move all files with 'method' in their name into it.

tests.name: Level 1: Delete Folder (Trash)
tests.prompt: Create a folder named 'Temp_ToTrash' in the root directory, then delete it (Box-style delete/trash).

tests.name: Level 1: Upload and Delete File (Trash)
tests.prompt: Upload a small text file named 'tmp_delete_me.txt' to the root folder with content 'delete-me'. Then delete the file (Box-style trash).

tests.name: Level 3: Typo Fix (Computational)
tests.prompt: In the history readings under digital humanities, there is a markdown file whose filename misspells the word 'computational' (letters swapped). Find it (try a couple search queries) and fix the typo in the filename without changing the content.

tests.name: Level 4: Read and Extract Slogan
tests.prompt: Find the plain-text study notes about Argentina's 2001 economic crisis (in the history area). Download/read the file and identify the protest slogan used during the December uprising. Post a comment on that file with the exact slogan text.
